repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
If your build environment uses literal globbing characters in its file paths, Cython 3.0 might fail, because `find_versioned_file` in `Utils.py` was slapping a `*` in the path and expecting it to properly glob. This fails in certain large build environments that use, for example, brackets in system paths. Escape paths from `sys.path` and other sources before looking for different versions of collateral files.

Closes GitHub issue [#5942](https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/5942)

comment_data.body: You can use `glob.escape()` for this. It's available since Py3.4, the master branch requires Py3.7+.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -305,7 +305,7 @@ def find_versioned_file(directory, filename, suffix,
     assert not suffix or suffix[:1] == '.'
     path_prefix = os.path.join(directory, filename)
 
-    matching_files = glob.glob(path_prefix + ".cython-*" + suffix)
+    matching_files = glob.glob(''.join([ '['+c+']' if c in '[]*?' else c for c in path_prefix]) + ".cython-*" + suffix)

comment_data.body:
Please remove the `_Tâ€¦` part of the file name. We use tags for this.
```suggestion
# tag: gh5942

PYTHON setup.py build_ext --inplace
```

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,33 @@
+PYTHON setup.py build_ext --inplace
+PYTHON -c "from tglob import mytest; mytest()"
+
+######## __init__.py ########
+
+######## tglob.pyx ########
+def mytest():
+    assert True
+######## setup.py ########

@@ -0,0 +1,33 @@
+PYTHON setup.py build_ext --inplace
+PYTHON -c "from tglob import mytest; mytest()"
+
+######## __init__.py ########
+
+######## tglob.pyx ########
+def mytest():
+    assert True
+######## setup.py ########
+import sys
+
+from Cython.Build.Dependencies import cythonize
+from distutils.core import setup, Extension
+
+sys.path.append("[Hello-World]*?")
+
+try:
+    from __builtin__ import reload
+except ImportError:
+    from importlib import reload
+reload(sys)  # Magic
+
+ext_modules = [
+    Extension(
+        "tglob",
+        sources=["tglob.pyx"],
+    )
+]
+
+setup(
+    ext_modules=cythonize(ext_modules, language_level="3"),
+)
+

comment_data.body: That was my first thought, but https://cython.org says "The C code is generated once and then compiles with all major C/C++ compilers in CPython 2.6, 2.7 (2.4+ with Cython 0.20.x) as well as 3.5 and all later versions" so I assumed I had to be backwards compatible with 2.6 and 2.7, but thanks for clarifying. I did see something in the source code about 3.7+ so I had conflicting information. I will fix this, thank you!
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -305,7 +305,7 @@ def find_versioned_file(directory, filename, suffix,

     path_prefix = os.path.join(directory, filename)
 
-    matching_files = glob.glob(path_prefix + ".cython-*" + suffix)
+    matching_files = glob.glob(''.join([ '['+c+']' if c in '[]*?' else c for c in path_prefix]) + ".cython-*" + suffix)

comment_data.body:
The website is a little outdated now in terms of what Cython supports.

The master branch is working towards a release that'll drop support for a lot of older versions but that release hasn't happened yet so it isn't _too_ misleading (yet)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -305,7 +305,7 @@ def find_versioned_file(directory, filename, suffix,
     assert not suffix or suffix[:1] == '.'
     path_prefix = os.path.join(directory, filename)
 
-    matching_files = glob.glob(path_prefix + ".cython-*" + suffix)
+    matching_files = glob.glob(''.join([ '['+c+']' if c in '[]*?' else c for c in path_prefix]) + ".cython-*" + suffix)

comment_data.body: Will do. Let's update the hacker documentation (https://github.com/cython/cython/wiki/HackerGuide#bugfeature-tracking-and-project-culture) which says "Either way, before a ticket gets fixed or assigned a milestone, there must be a failing test case in the appropriate `tests/` directory (preferably `tests/run`) that is named `nicely_descriptive_name_here_Txyz.pyx` (where `xyz` is the ticket number)." Is there a way I can do this, or else a ticket I can file somewhere?

@da-woods So is it best to leave it as-is for now? We are eager to have this fix sooner than later because it breaks our build. Perhaps I can file a follow-on ticket to clean it up for the strict 3.7+ release and leave it as technical debt?

comment_data.body:
This suggested change fails the test. Working on a fix.

This was the failure. I am not sufficiently facile with the tools to be able to root cause it; somehow the shared library is not getting generated because it's trying to put it in a spurious directory that doesn't exist:

comment_data.body: I made it more compact without changing the semantics. If the semantics need to be changed and the fix passes the test, let me know what the changes are. Thanks for your help!

commit.message:
Tolerate and escape globbing characters in sys.path

If your build environment uses literal globbing characters, Cython 3.0
might fail, because `find_versioned_file` in `Utils.py` was slapping a
`*` in the path and expecting it to properly glob. This fails in
certain large build environments that use, for example, brackets in
system paths. Escape paths from sys.path and other sources before
looking for different versions of collateral files.

Closes GitHub issue [#5942](https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/5942)

Simplify test

Clean up and simplify the unit test.

Add ticket tag

Current workflow requirements dictate that the ticket be included as a tag in the file rather than in the filename. I will follow-up and rename the file in a distinct commit.

Co-authored-by: scoder <stefan_ml@behnel.de>
